task.title: Adding groups
task.shortdesc: When you create a group, it automatically contains a content model. The content model is a representation of any data that can be grouped together by the group, such as elements, element references, and group references.

context.p: The following instructions were written for the Resource perspective, but they wsill also work in many other perspectives.
To add a group, complete the following steps:

step.cmd: Open your XML schema in the XML schema editor.
In the Outline view, right-click Groups, and click Add Group.
In the Properties view, type a new name for the group in the Name field.
Click the Documentation tab if you want to provide any information about this group element.
step.info: The Documentation page is used for human readable material, such as a description.

step.cmd: Click the Extensions tab if you want to add application information elements to your annotations of schema components.
step.info: The Extensions page allows you to specify the schema and add XML content to your annotations.

step.cmd: In the Outline view, expand the Groups folder and your new group.
step.info: Your group automatically contains a content model. A group's content model is the representation of any data that can be contained inside the group. For more information about working with content models, refer to the related tasks.
